result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald E. Lafayette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald E. Lafayette is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald E. Lafayette was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).
  • Ronald E. Lafayette was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CF404.
***AJOC-Def is allowed sentence credit of 44 days.***

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Costs from Count 3 are to be paid while on extended supervison on Count 1.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

supervisions.notes: Costs on count 3 are to be paid while on extended supervison on count 1.

records.addlTxt: Dated October 18, 2018 - IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 11, 2018, that: IT IS ORDERED that the judgements are summarily affirmed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Thomas J. Erickson is relieved of further representing Lafayette in these matters.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Copy of certified COA order decided on September 11, 2018 returned with remittitur.

Dated September 11, 2018 - IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Thomas J. Erickson is relieved of further representing Lafayete in these matters. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the summary disposition order will not be published.

Minutes:  14CF374/15CF404/15CF417.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Braun appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CF404 - deft sentenced to 9yrs WSP; initial confinement of 6yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

15CF417 - deft sentenced to 3yrs WSP consec to 15CF404; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 1yr of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

14CF374 - (Count 3) - deft sentenced to 6mos WSP concurrent to 15CF404.  (Count 1) - deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP concurrent to 15CF404; initial confinement of 4yrs followed by 2yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

Bond money to be applied to financial obligations.  Any balance remaining may be returned to poster.  Credit to be determined by the attys and submitted to the court for approval.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
defense counsel out ill today; sentencing hrg to be rescheduled

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Case is resolved.  

Count 1 - second/subsequent enhancer & park enhancer are both dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; admits to repeater.

Count 3 - second/subsequent enhancer dismissed on State's motion.  deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; admits to repeater.

Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/16/15 @ 1:30pm.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion.  State has no objection to reinstatement of the previous cash bond.  Court grants the motion; $1,000 cash bond is reinstated.

***Deft to post $10,000 in addition to the $1,000 already posted***

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Henry.  Atty Henry moves to w/draw as counsel; deft concurs with this request.  Atty Henry reports the deft has missed several office appts and she has been unable to confer with the deft regarding this case.  Deft amended to $10,000 cash in addition to the $1,000 already posted.  Deft taken into custody.  FPT changed to 1/22/15 @ 10:30am.  Ludwig hrg will be held at the next court hrg.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Henry appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Case called @ 1:46pm; was scheduled for 1:30pm.  Bench warrant authorized; $2500 cash bond.  Stayed until noon on 1/9/15.  Deft appeared @ 1:49pm.  Warrant vacated.  Atty Henry reports the case is not resolved.  Court commences ludwig hrg hrg; ludwig hrg interrupted to allow Atty Henry to confer w/her client.  Court reconvenes.  Atty Henry requests an adjournment of the FPT/JS dates for the reasons set forth on the record.  Court will adjourn the FPT to 1/12/15 @ 11:30am.  JS date to remain for 1/26/15 @ 9am

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. was given time to retain other counsel, but has been unable to do so.  Atty Henry to continue to represent def.  Def. has not appeared for scheduled meetings with Atty Henry.  Jury selection on 12/8/14 is removed from the calendar.  FPT 1/8/15  at 1:30.  Jury selection 1/26/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Henry.  Atty Henry reports she has not had contact w/deft.  Deft reports he wishes to retain counsel.  Court adjourns the FPT to allow the parties to confer and/or give the deft time to retain counsel.  FPT set for 11/17/14 @ 11am.  JS to remain as previously fixed.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Aileen Henry appeared on behalf of deft.  Due to ongoing jury trial, case called 5 minutes early.  Court requests Atty Henry wait until 3:40pm in the event the deft appeared.  Otherwise - BW authorized; $5000 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.  NOTE - deft appeared @ 3:30pm.  Previous orders are vacated.  Deft admonished about not keeping/contacting his atty.  Deft's address is confirmed on the record - CCAP record is correct.  Deft reports he is having difficulty receiving mail at that address.  Court instructed deft to go to the Post Office and find out what the problem is with this address/him not receiving mail.  FPT 10/28/14 @ 2:15pm, JT 12/8/14 @ 9am.  NOTE - Atty Henry has trial in branch 7 this day as well
